I'm pretty good at running :)

As an aside, I just did a little experiment with a northern valkyrie (north
barbarian). I was level 2, and in a spot where monsters spawned at a blink
rate (one every 15 s or so). I stayed at a tiny smudge of the full life total
(about 5HP) while bashing monsters. I was 2 bubbles away from 3, and finally
died when I was 1 bubble into level 3... One to three monsters were bashing on
me permanently. I even hadn't time to loot the corpses.

Make me want to try my next life as a Troll Warrior :)

> that you will resist this little 2 orcs a bit longer, is a life of a
> wizard. I hope that at last in later lv somone will call i need a wizard in
> group now ( less then 16 lv ) i never seen anyone searching for a wizard
> clerics, paladins, druids are all time requested so calling healing classes
> we nukers are out of game for now sight sight (strange bards are more
> requestesd in group and they have better solo play then wizards)

Buffs. All their efforts go into making tanks stronger, when those efforts
would be better invested in making monsters dead in the first place :)

That changes as levels increase. There are monsters with high ACs, so even
high-level warriors have problems hitting them. But nuking works fine, the
monster's magic resistance doesn't differ much. I spent time on sunday in
a party with two wizards, 1 cleric, 1 paladin, and 2 magicians whose pets
served as aux. tanks. The only hard spots for us was when there was more
than 8 monsters at a time on us... That's when some started to get
interested in the wizards... Woops. Time to Fade/Shadow Step... (the range
intervenes when the monsters select a target, so when they get interested in
you, Shadow Step moves you out of range, they lose interest, and you can get
back in range for Shocks but you have to know the local area well to find out
where you are and get quickly back in range)

Those who think all they need is tanks and healers haven't invested much
in the way of IQ levels :)
